projects:
[{'title': 'Sustainable aquaculture to support mangrove forest restoration in Indonesia (PASMI).', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': "The research focuses on developing multi-trophic coastal aquaculture systems, which can support the restoration of (1) the farmer's livelihoods and (2) the mangrove forests in Indonesia. In these systems, different organisms, such as shrimp, blue crab and others, will be produced in an integrated way, thereby supporting resilient livelihoods while also safeguarding the mangrove functions for coastal protection. The research supports mangrove restoration projects in three  regencies/villages along the north coast of Java: Demak, Brebes (Kaliwlingi village) and Sawah Luhur village, bordering Banten Bay and Pulau Dua Nature Reserve. 
Parters: 
- Wetlands International Indonesia, 
- Diponegoro University’s Faculty of Fisheries and Marine Science (Semarang). 
- Ecoshape (Deltares, Imares, BosKalis, Witteveen & Bos, IHE).", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Roel H.', 'last_name': 'Bosma', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sustainable Agriculture Production System Expert at Nedworc Foundation'}]}, {'title': 'SuPa: Sustainable Pangasius farming through feed & waste management', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Roel H.', 'last_name': 'Bosma', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sustainable Agriculture Production System Expert at Nedworc Foundation'}]}]
